content:
It sounds like you've already taken a great step in upgrading your bedroom's lighting with the new LED ceiling light fixture. LED lighting is not only energy-efficient but also provides better brightness and longer lifespan compared to traditional lighting options.

Cleaning the switch and checking the bulb are excellent first steps in troubleshooting the floor lamp issue. If that doesn't resolve the problem, replacing the lamp might be the next best option.

Remember to also consider the lamp's design, functionality, and style when deciding whether to replace it. You might want to look for a lamp that complements your bedroom's decor and provides the right amount of light for your needs.

Since you've already upgraded your ceiling light fixture, you might want to consider matching the style and finish of the new lamp to create a cohesive look in your bedroom. Additionally, think about the type of light you need in that area. Do you want a task-oriented lamp for reading or a more ambient light for relaxation?

Keep me posted on how the troubleshooting goes, and if you need any more advice or recommendations, feel free to ask!
